titleStmt.title: Concerning a treaty: to reconcile the differences, and vnite the spirits of godly ministers. Who have hitherto stood for a reformation. Three things offer themselves to be considered in a treaty of this nature, at this time. 1. What should induce conscionable men now to desire such a treaty. 2. What the proper aime and designe of the treaty should be. 3. By what wayes and meanes it may become effectual to reach that aime and designe.

Concerning a treaty: to reconcile the differences, and vnite the spirits of godly ministers. Who have hitherto stood for a reformation. Three things offer themselves to be considered in a treaty of this nature, at this time. 1. What should induce conscionable men now to desire such a treaty. 2. What the proper aime and designe of the treaty should be. 3. By what wayes and meanes it may become effectual to reach that aime and designe.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Cambridge University Library.
